report.label: bug

report.summary: Tag can be added multiple times to individual note.
report.label: bug
report.description: This feels like a bug but maybe its by design? To reproduce: Add a new note. Add a tag. Add the same tag again. Repeat if desired. Save note. Outcome: The same tag appears on the note multiple times. However it appears in the tag's list of notes only once. I think I'd expect dup tags to not appear in the edit field at all.

report.summary: Screen flashes when changing orientation.

report.summary: Tag field's keyboard has a 'Next' button that does nothing.
report.label: bug

report.summary: Sign in progress alert could have a better title.
report.label: bug
report.description: When I sign into the app, a dialog is shown titled "Account Setup". This seemed a little confusing since I've already set up an account and I'm just signing into the app. Could the dialog say "Signing in" or something similar instead?

report.summary: Easy to unintentionally created incorrect tags.
report.label: bug
report.description: Not 100% sure this is a bug per se, but this was a recurring event so I wanted to raise awareness. When typing on the Nexus 7, I noticed that the tags I was typing would be "interrupted' and instead of a single tag, I'd end up with two or more tags that were word-parts of what I was trying to type. For instance: if I was adding a tag named "debugging", I might end up with "de" "ugg" "ng". It was hard to say if a tag was being created due to hesitation in typing or something else but its not a very good experience and seemed to happen frequently.

report.summary: Reduce network and battery usage
report.label: bug
report.description: Simplenote is using more battery than seems reasonable when compared with the amount of use the app is getting. My assumption is that once Simplenote is launched it will keep the socket connected (and therefore the WiFi and cell radios fully powered) even when the app is not displayed on screen. Ideally Simplenote should be able to tell Simperium to stop all buckets when the main activity is paused. Simperium should then complete any pending changes for each bucket and then close the websocket.

report.summary: Smarter tag recounting

report.summary: Unexpected merge can remove note content
report.label: bug
report.description: Turn on airplane mode. Edit an existing note by adding a new line at the end, and a few lines of content. Go to the web app and also add some content at the end of the note with more lines than what you added in the Android app. Turn off airplane mode. Now the notes are displaying different content depending on the platform. In the web app I see that it did its best to merge the content. In the Android app it appears to take whatever was in the web app and not merge in the changes that it had locally. If I make any change in the Android app it will remove all of the merged changes in the web app.

report.summary: Respect markdown setting
report.label: bug
report.description: While Simplenote on Android ignores anything about markdown, the web app allows users to mark notes as "Markdown formatted" which in turn: Shows a "Preview" option in the web editor Renders a published note through a markdown to HTML renderer. The Android app should not modify this property for a note. The problem as steps: Open web editor (https://simple-note.appspot.com) Click on the info icon for the note Check "Markdown formatted" in the the modal overlay Open the Android app Edit the note from step 3 in the android app Return to the web app to see that the note is no longer marked as "Markdown formatted" What should happen? The note should still be "Markdown formatted" even though it was edited from the android app.

report.summary: Note content duplication
report.label: bug
report.description: There's been a few reports of notes repeating content. From a user: From my experience it seems to happen at random... I can't say for sure, but I seem to recall that a lot of the times I open up the app on my phone to quickly add / paste something to a note and then close it and put the phone to sleep, only to find out a few hours later that it's mangled when I look at it on my desktop. The curious thing, though, is that it looks fine when I open it on my phone again. Last time this happened, I moved the note to the trash, then restored it (all of this from the app on my phone), and when it synced the note was back to normal on all clients.

report.summary: Creating notes without an account can result in losing notes
report.label: bug
report.description: When you first open the Android app after downloading it there's an option at the bottom of the screen to "just try the app". This will let users create notes without signing into, or creating, an account. If they later create a new account in the app the notes are copied into it. However if they sign into an existing account, the notes that were created offline will appear on the device but they never appear in the same account when signing in through a web browser. If the user then signs out of their account on the device and signs back in again, all those "local notes" are lost. I think it might be better to remove the option to create notes without an account, or at the very least, provide a warning that signing into an account will result in notes being lost. I hope this makes sense! Ticket: https://simplenote.desk.com/agent/case/62933

report.summary: Infinite failed PIN lock attempts
report.label: bug
report.description: Not sure if this is intended but failing to enter the correct PIN lock code allows you to keep trying an infinite (tested up to 34 on my end) number of times Steps to reproduce: Launch Simplenote. Activate the PIN lock feature under Settings > Turn PIN lock On. Add a 4 digit passcode, for instance 1234. Close the app and relaunch. Enter a wrong passcode. Keep entering the wrong passcode. What would I expect? As you get stuck in the unlock screen and there's no message for the user on how to workaround that or access to their notes, I'd suggest a message after 3 failed attempts on the lines of "Have you lost access to Simplenote? You can regain access by re-installing the app and logging into your account." As reinstalling the app would request your email and password in order to log in, that should be alright and at the same time there's an effective way to get out of the loop of not being able to access to your account and not getting a message on how to solve that.

report.summary: Case sensitive seach for Cyrillic characters
report.label: bug
report.description: Reported at 3107673-t , seems that Cyrillic characters (for example, Russian) are case sensitive in the search field. If you're looking for the notes with a certain word, only those notes with the exact same case match will show up. Steps to reproduce: 1 - Switch your input keyboard to Russian. 2 - Create two notes with the same string but different casing, for example: Я люблю гречку and Я Люблю гречку 3 - Search for one of the strings, foe example люблю . Only one note shows up instead of both. In English works, and also other versions, the problem seems to be just in Android.
